column2: To search for a district, hit Ctrl-F.  A search box will open in the upper right of the spreadsheet.  Type in what you have for the district name in Farsi, Pashto, or Roman characters.  Matches will be highlighted.  If there is no match at first, try a portion of the name.  When you get a potential match, check to see that it is in the right province.

The district sets differ due to district splits and mergers over time.    The colored columns indicate which district set includes what districts.   Use the one most appropriate to your needs.  For database work, code identifications are crucial, but standard spellings shouldn't be.  See footnotes for more.

column3: District names, alternate names, common spellings, and notes. (2)
Baharak, Bahorak.  (There is also a Baharak district in Takhar.)
Darwaz-e-Bala, Upper Darwaz, Mamai, Mam May.  (Several sources mistakenly reverse Mamai, the center of Darwaz-e-Bala, with Nesay, the center of Darwaz-e-Payin.)
Darwaz-e-Payin, Darwas-e Pa'in, Nesay, Nesai, Lower Darwaz.  (Several sources mistakenly reverse Mamai, the center of Darwaz-e-Bala, with Nesay, the center of Darwaz-e-Payin.)
Eshkashim, Ishkashem.  (Eshkashim is sometimes confused with Eshkamish district of Takhar.)
Faiz Abad, Fayzabad.  (There is also a Faizabad district in Jowzjan.)
Kiran Wa Menjan, Kirn wa Manjan, Koran o Monjan.
Kohistan, Kohestiani.  (There is also a Kohistan in Faryab, a Hissa-e-Awali Kohistan in Kapisa, a Hissa-e Duome Kohistan in Kapisa, and a Kohistanat in Saripul.)
Raghistan, Ragh.  (There is also a Registan in Kandahar.)
Shahri Buzurg, Shahr-e-Buzorg, Shahr-e Buzurg, Shar-e-Buzurg.
Yaftal-e-Sufla, Yaftal Payin, Yaftal-i-Paen, Lower Yaftal.
Ghormach, Ghormuch.  (All of the district sets presented here list Ghormach in Badghis.  The IDLG, along with many news sources, report it as part of Faryab.)
Muqur, Moqur, Moqor.  (There is also a Moqur district in Ghazni.)
Qadis.  (Some consider Dara-e Bom to be a district.  It is included in Qadis here.)
Baghlan-e-Jadeed, Baghlani Markazi, Baghlan Markazi.  (There was once a "Baghlan" district.  It is now part of what all of these sets report as Baghlan-e-Jadeed.)
Dahana-e-Ghuri, Dahanah-ye Ghori, Dahana-e-Ghori, Dand-e Ghor.
Firing Wa Gharu, Fereng Wa Gharu, Farang wa Gharu, Farang.
Khost Wa Firing, Khost Wa Fereng, Khost Ferent, Khost.  (Khost Wa Firing is not the same as Firing Wa Gharu of Baghlan.)
Khwaja Hejran, Jalga, Khwajahejran, Khwajah Higran.
Pul-e-Hisar, Pul-i Hesar, Pul-e Hesar, Pule Hisar.
Tala Wa Barfak, Talah wa Barfak, Tala Barfak.
Char Kent, Charkent, Charkint, Chahar Kent, Char Kant.
Dawlat Abad, Dawlatabad, Dolatabad.  (There is also a Dawlatabad in Faryab, and a Dawlatshah in Laghman, and a Dawlatyar in Ghor.)
Kaldar.  (All three sets reported recognize Sharak-e-Hayratan as having been split from Kaldar.  The CSO 421 set (not listed here) shows Sharak-e-Hayratan as part of Kaldar.)
Sharak-e-Hairatan, Sharak-i-Hayratan.  (The 421 district set, not listed here, shows Sharak-e-Hairatan as part of Kaldar.)
Yakawlang, Yakawlang No. 1, Yakawlang Hesa-i Awal, Yakawland Hise Awal.  (The 399 and 407 sets show Yakawlang No. 2 as part of Yakawlang.)
Yakawlang No. 2, Yakawlang Hesa-i-Doyem.  (The 399 and 407 sets show Yakawlang No. 2 as part of Yakawlang.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)

Gizab, Gezab.  (The 399 AGCHO 2012 set and the 407 RS / USFOR-A set show Gizab as including Pato, and in Daikundi.  The 422 AGCHO / ARAZI set shows a rump Gizab, split from Patoo, in Urozgan.  It isn't clear how the Permanent 399 AGCHO / ARAZI means to define Gizab.    Its borders show the original Gizab, including Pato, in Daikundi, but it codes Gizab to Urozgan.
Patoo, Pato, Patu.  (Patoo is part of Gizab district in the 399 and 407 sets.  It is a "temporary" district in the 422 set.)
Sang-e-Takht, Sangi Takht, Sang-e-Takht Bandar, Bandar.
Pushtrud, Pushtrod, Pusht-e Rod, Pusht Road, Poshtrud.
Qala-i-Kah, Qala-e-Kah, Qalah-e Kah Qul'ah-ye Kah, Pusht Koh.
Dawlat Abad, Dawlatabad, Dowlatabad..  (There is also a Dawlatabad in Balkh, and a Dawlatshah district in Laghman, and a Dawlatyar district in Ghor.)
Khani Charbagh, Khan-e-Char Bagh. Khan-e Chahr Bagh, Khan Chahr Bagh.
Kohistan, Lowlash,.  (There is also a Kohistanat in Saripul, and two Kohistans in Badakhshan and Kapisa.)
Shirin Tagab, Shirintagab, Sherin Tagab, Sherin Tagau.  (There is also a Tagab in Kapisa and in Badakhshan.)
Jaghatu, Jaghato, Jighatu, Bahrami Shahid, Bahram-e Shahid, Waeez Shahid, Wais Shahid.  (There is also a Jaghatu in Wardak province.)
Khwaja Omari, Khwajah Omari, Khwajaumari, Khwaja Umari.
Nawa, Nawah.  (There is also a Nawa (aka Nawa-i-Barakzai) in Helmand, and a Nawur district in Ghazni.)
Qara Bagh, Qarabagh, Qarah Bagh.  (There is also a Qara Bagh district of Kabul.)
Khugyani, Khogiani, Khoghiani, Wali Muhammad Shahid, Wali Muhammad-e-Shahid .  (There is also a Khugyani in Nangarhar.)
Chighcheran, Chaghcheran, Feroz Koh, Ferozkoh.  (Chighcheran includes parts of what some call "Murghab" district. There is also a Murghab district in Badghis.)
Dawlatyar, Dolatyar, Dawlat Yar.  (There is also a Dawlatshar in Laghman, a Dawlat Abad in Faryab, and a Dawlatabad in Balkh.)
Lal Wa SarJangal, La'l wa SarJangal.
Baghran.  (Nawamish is part of Baghran in the 399, 401, and 407 district sets, but is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Marja.  (Marja is part of Nad Ali in the 399 district sets, but separate in the 407 set.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Nad Ali, Nad-e-Ali, Nad 'Ali, Nadali. (Marja is part of Nad Ali in the 399 district set.)
Nawa-i-Barikzayi, Nawa-e-Barakzaiy, Nawah-ye-Barakzai, Nawa, Shamalan.  (There is also a Nawa district in Ghazni.)
Nawamish, Nawamesh, Nawa Mesh.  (Nawamish is part of Baghran in the 399 and 407 district sets, but as a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Reg-e-Khan Nishin, Reg, Khan Neshin.  (There is also a Reg, or Registan, in Kandahar.)
Koh-i-Zor, Kozeor.  (Koh-i-Zor is part of Shindand in the 399 and 407 sets.)
Kushk-i-Kuhna, Kushk-e-Kohna, Kashak Kohna, Koshk-e Kohna.
Pusht-i-Koh, Pusht-e-Koh, Pusht Koh, Poshtko.  (Pusht-e Koh is part of Shindand in the 399 and 407 sets. It is a temporary district of the 422 set.)

Shindand, Sabzwar, Esfezar.  (The original Shindand is reported in the 399 and 407 sets.  Shindand is reported as a permanent district in the AGCHO 2018 set.  Some copies of the 422 set incorrectly report it as both a permanent and a temporary district).
Zawol, Zewal.  (Zawol is part of Shindand in the 399 and 407 sets, but is a "temporary" district in the 422 set.)
Zer-i-Koh, Zerko.  (Zer-i Koh is part of Shindand in the 399 and 407 sets.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Faizabad, Fayzabad, Faiz Abad.  (There is also a Faiz Abad district in Badakhshan.)
Khwajadukoh, Khwaja Dukoh, Khwajah Do Koh, Kohja Dukoh.
Bagrami.  (There is also a Bagram in Parwan. The airfield is in Baghram of Parwan, not Baghrami.)
Chahar Asyab, Chaharasyab, Char Asyab, Char Asiab.
DehSabz, Deh-e Sabz, Deh Sabz, Dih Sabz.
Guldara, Gul Dara, Gul Darah, Guldra.
Khak-e-Jabar, Khak-i-Jabar, Khak Jabar, Khaki Jabbar.
Qara Bagh, Qarahbagh, Qarabagh.  (There is also a Qara Bagh district in Ghazni.)
Surubi, Sarobi, Sorubi, Sarubi, Surobi.  (There is also a Surubi in Paktika.)
Arghandab.  (There is also an Argandab in Zabul.)
Dand.  (There is also a Dand Patan district in Paktia.  Dand is part of the Kandahar capital district in both 399 sets, but separate in the 407 and a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Kandahar, Qandahar.  (Dand is part of the Kandahar capital district in both 399 sets.)
Miyanishin, Miyanshin, Miyaneshin, Mya Nishin, Myan-e-Sheen.
Reg, Registan.  (There is also a Reg-e Khan Neshin, in Kandahar, and a Ragistan in Badakhshan.)
Shah Wali Kot, Shahwalikot, Shah Walikot..
Shorabak.  (There is also a military base named Shorabak, formerly Camp Bastion, in Washir, Helmand.)
Spin Boldak, Spinboldak.  (Takhta Pul is part of Spin Boldak in the 399 an 407 sets.)
Takhta Pul, Shegah.  (Takhta Pul was part of Spin Boldak in the 399 an 407 sets.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)

Hissa-e-Awali Kohistan, Hisah-e Awal-e Kohistan, Kohistan Awal, Kohistani Awal.  (There is also a Hissa-e-Duwumi Kohistan in Kapisa, a Kohistan in Badakhshan, another Kohistan in Faryab, and Kohistanat in Saripul.)

Hissa-e-Duwumi Kohistan, Hisah-e Dowum-e Kohistan, Kohistan-I-Duwum.  (There is also a Hissa-e-Awali Kohistan in Kapisa, a Kohistan in Badakhshan, another Kohistan in Faryab, and a Kohistanat in Saripul.)
Jaji Maidan, Jajimaydan, Jaji, Zazi Maidan, Zazi, Zazai.
Manduzay, Esmayel Khil, Mandozayi, Manduzai, Ismail Khel, Mando Zayi.
Tirzayee, Terezayi, Tere Zayi, Ali Sher, Alisher.
Bar Kunar, Bar Konar, Barkunar, Asmar.
Dara-e-Pech, Dara-I-Pech, Darah-ye Pech, Pech Dara, Mano Gai, Manogai, Manogay.
Sawkai, Sowkay, Chawkai, Chowkay, Chawkey, Tsokey, Sewki.
Sheltan, Soltan.  (The Shigal and the Sheltan areas are combined as Shigal wa Sheltan in the 399 and 407 sets.  Sheltan is temporary district in the 422 set.)

Shigal, Shigal wa Sheltan. (The Shigal and the Sheltan areas are combined as "Shigal wa Sheltan" in the 407 both of the 399 sets.  The rump district in the All 422 set is just "Shigal".  Sheltan is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Aqtash.  (Aqtash is part of Khan Abad in the 399 and 407 sets.  It is a temporary district of the 422 set)
Kalbad, Calbad, Galbad, Qulbad.  (Kalbad is part of Imam Sahib in the 399 and 407 sets.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)

Gultipa, Gurtepa, Goltipa.  (Originally Gur Tepa, or Tomb Hill, but rebranded as Gultipa, Flower Hill.  Gurtipa is part of the Kunduz capital district in the 399 and 407 sets.   It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Imam Sahib, Hazrati Imam Sahib, Emamsaheb, Emam Sahib.  Imam Sahib includes Galbad in the 399 and 407 sets.  Galbad is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Khan Abad, Khanabad.  (Khan Abad includes Aqtash in the 399 and 407 sets.  Aqtash is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Kunduz, Konduz.  (The Kunduz capital district includes Gul Tipa in the 399 and 407 sets.)
Bad Pash, Badpash, Bad Pakh, Badpakh, Bad Pakh Shaitan.  (Bak Pash is part of Mehterlam in the 399 sets, but separate in the 407 set.  It is a temporary district of the 422 set.)
Dawlat Shah, Dawlatshah.  (There is also a Dawlatyar in Ghor, a Dawlatabad in Balkh, and another Dawlat Abad in Faryab.)
Mehterlam, Mehtarlam, Mehtar Lam, Meterlam (incorrect).  (Bak Pash is part of Mehterlam in the 399 set.)
Qarghayee, Ghani Khel, Qarghayi, Qarghah'i, Ghanikhel, Ghanikhil.  (There is also a Ghani Khel (aka Shinwar) district in Nangarhar.)
Achen, Achin, Acheen, Achine.  (Spingar is part of Achin in the 399 and 407 sets, but is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Behsud, Bihsud, Behsod.  (There is a Markaz-e-Behsud district, and a Hise-e-Awal-e-Behsud district, both in Wardak.
Deh Bala, Dehbala, Haska Mina, Haska Mena.
Lalpoor, Lalpur, La'lpur, Lalpor, Lal Pur.
Muhmand Dara, Mohmand Darah, Muhmand Dara, Mohmandara, Muhmanddara. (There is also Mohmand Dara valley in Achin.)
Sher Zad, Sherzad, Shir Zad, Shirzad.
Shinwar, Ghanikhel, Ghani Kahil.  (There is also a Ghani Khel (aka  Qarghayee) district in Laghman.)
Spinghar, Spin Ghar, Spingar,   (Spinghar district is part of Achin in the 399 and 407 sets.  Spingar is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Surkh Rud, Surkhrud, Surkh Rod, Surkhrod, Sorkh Roud.
Dilaram, Delaram.  (Dilaram is part of Kashrod in the 399 district set.  Dilaram is separate in the 407 set.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Khashrod, Khash Rod, Khash Rud, Khashrud.  (Dilaram is part of Kashrod in the 399 set.)
Bargi Matal, Barg-i-Matal, Barg-e-Matal, Barg-e-Mataal, Bargromatal.
Noor Gram, Noorgram, Nurgeram, Norgram, Nurgram, Nangarage.
Paroon, Paron, Poruns, Parun, Parune, Prasun.
Waygal, Want Wagal, Wegal, Want Wegal.
Dand Patan, Dand wa Patan, Dand-e Patan.  (There is also a Dand district in Kandahar.)
Garda Siray.  (Garda Siray is part of Waze Zadran in the 399 and 407 sets.  It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Jaji, Jaji Maidan, Zazi, Zazi Aryob, Alikhel, Ali Khel, Aryoub Zazai.
Jani Khel, Janikhel.  (There is also a Jani Khel in Paktika.)
Laja Ahmad Khel, Ahmadkhel, Ahmad Khel.  (Laja Ahmad Khel includes Laja Mangal in both of the 399 sets, but not the 407 or 422 sets.)
Laja Mangel, Laja Mangal, Lazha Mangal.  (The Laja Mangel area is included in Laja Ahmad Khel in both 399 sets.  Laja Mangal is separate in the 407 set.  It is temporary district in the 422 set.)
Mirzaka, Mirzakah, Meer Zaka.  (Mirzaka is part of Sayyid Karam in the 399 set.  It is a separate district in the 407 set, and a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Rohany Baba, Rohani Baba.  (Rohany Baba is part of Zurmat in the 399 and 407 sets. It is a temporary district in the 422 set.)
Samkani, Chamkani, Chamkani, Tchamkani, Tsamkani, Samkani, Samkanai.
There is also a Sayyad district in Sar-e-Pul, a Sayyid Khel in Parwan, and a Sayyid Abad district in Wardak.  (Mirzaka is part of Sayyid Karam in the 399 sets, but split off in the others.)
Wuza Zadran, Zadran, Dzadran,.  (Garda Siray is part of Waze Zadran in the 399 and 407 sets, but separate in the 422 set.)
Zurmat, Zormat.  (Zurmat includes Rohany Baba in the 399 and 407 sets, but not in the 422 set.)
Dila Wa Khushamand, Dila, Dilah, Khushamand.
Gomal, Gumal.  (Chaharbaran is part of Gomal in these district sets, but is often refered to as a district.)
Jani Khel, Janikhel.  (There is also a Jani Khel in Paktia.)
Sar Rawza, Sar Hawza, Sarrawzah, Sarhawzah, Sar Hawzeh.
Surubi, Sarobi, Sorubi, Sarubi, Surobi.  (There is also a Sorubi district in Kabul province.)
Wazakhwah, Waza Khwa, Wazah Khwah, Wazi Khwa.
Wormamay, Wur Mamay, Wormamai, Wormami, Wor Mamay.
Zarghun Shahr, Khair Kot, Katawaz, Zarghunshahr.
Abshar, Ab Shar.  (Abshar is part of Darah in the 399 sets, but is separate in 407 set, and is a temporary district of the 422 set.)
Darah, Dara.  (Abshar is part of Darah in the 399 sets, but not the others.)
Jabulussaraj, Jabal Saraj, Jabal us Saraj.
Sayyid Khel, Saydkhel. There is also a Sayyad district in Sar-e-Pul, a Sayyid Karam in Paktia, and a Sayyid Abad district in Wardak.
Shaykh Ali, Sheikh Ali, Shekhali, Shaykh 'Ali.
Shinwari.  (There is also a Shinwar district in Nangarhar.)
Surkh Parsa, Surkhi Parsa, Surkh-e-Parsa, Surkhe Parsa, Surkh-o Parsa, Lolinge, Lowlenge.
Dara-e-Soof-e-Bala, Darah-ye-Suf-e Bala, Darah-e-Souf-e Bala, Dara-i-Sauf Bala.
Dara-e-Soof-i-Payin, Darah-ye-Suf-e Pa'in, Dara-e-Sof-e-Payin, Dara-e-Souf-e-Payan, Dara-i-Sauf Paeen.
Khuram Wa Sarbagh,Khuram wa Sar Bagh, Khuram Sarbagh.
Rui-Do-Ab, Ruy-e-Duab, Ruy Do Ab, Rui Doab, Doab.
Kohistanat.  (There are Kohistan districts in both Badakhshan and Faryab. There is a Hissa-e-Awali Kohistan, and a Hissa-e Duome Kohistan, both in Kapisa.)
Sayyad, Sayad.  (There is also a Sayyid Khel district in Parwan, a Sayyid Karam in Paktika, and a Sayyid Abad district in Wardak.)
Baharak.  (There is also a Baharak in Badakhshan.)
Chahab, Chah Ab, Cha-e-Ab, Chahi Ab.
Dashti Qala, Dasht-i-Qala, Dasht-e-Qala,, Dasht-e Qal'ah.
Eshkamesh, Ishkamish.  (There is also an Eshkashim district in Badakhshan.)
Chinarto, Chenarto, Chinar Tu.  (Chinarto is part of Chora in both 399 sets.  Chinarto is separate in the 407 set, and is a temporary district of the 422 set.)
Chora, Chorah.  (Chora includes Chinarto in both 399 district sets.  The 407 and 422 sets show Chinarto split from Chora.)

Gizab, Gezab.  (See the Gizab row in the Daikundi section.  The 399 AGCHO and 407 RS / USFOR-A district sets show Gizab in Daikundi.  The 422 district set, and maybe the Permanent 399 AGCHO / ARAZI set, put Gizab in Urozgan.)  .
Shahidi Hassas, Shaidi Assas, Charchino, Char China.  (Sia Sang is included in Shahidi Hassas in all district sets, but some consider it to be a district.)
Hissa-e-Awal-e-Behsud, Hesa-e Awal-e Behsud, Hisa-i-Awal-i Bihsud.  (There is also a Markazi Behsud in Wardak, and a Behsud in Nangarhar.)
Jaghatu, Jaghato.  (There is also a Jaghatu district in Ghazni.)
Markaz-e-Behsud, Markaz-i-Bihsud.  (There is also a Hisa-e-Awal-e-Behsud district in Wardak, and a Behsud district in Nangarhar.)
Sayyid Abad, Saydabad, Sayyidabad, Sayedabad.  (There is also a Sayyad district in Sar-e-Pul, a Sayyid Karam in Paktia, and a Sayyid Khel in Parwan.)
Arghandab.  (There is also an Arghandab in Kandahar.)
Shinkai, Shinkay.  (There is also a Shinkai area in Kapisa.  The Surri (or Seuri, Sewray) area is included in Shinkai in all of these district sets, but many think of it as a district.)
Tarnak wa Jaldak, Jeldak, Jaldak, Shahr-e-Safa, Shar-e-Safa.

column2: (1) Province name:  Province name using generally accepted transliterations.  This list follows the CSO in putting Gizab district in Urugzan, but the 399 sets have it in Daikundi.

column3: (2) District names...  This column includes notes about district splits after the 399 district set of 2012, and the 24 new "temporary" districts they created by the time the 422 district map was issued in 2018.  The column also offers a variety of district names and spellings to help searches.  Some of the transliterations are poor, but common.

column4: (3) 399 AGCHO set:  The set was established and mapped by the Afghan government and mapped by AGCHO/AIMS in June 2005, but without Sharak-e-Hayratan.  It was updated by the AGCHO in 2012 with improved borders and the addition of  Sharak-e-Hayratan.  The 399 set is the one most commonly used in the aid community.  Sources: Afghanistan - Estimated Population 2016/2017, UN OCHA Afghanistan, 8/11/16. https://data.humdata.org/dataset/914eb41e-adbc-4b1b-9ab3-b3787f3c7191.  The corresponding boundary set: UNOCHA HDX website: https://data.humdata.org/dataset/afg-admin-boundaries

column6: (4) 407 district set: The 2012 set used by Resolute Support and USFOR-A in its control / security level reporting.  Source: Quarterly Report to the US Congress; SIGAR; April 30 2018  https://www.sigar.mil/pdf/quarterlyreports/2018-04-30qr.pdf

column7: (5) 422 AGCHO / ARAZI set of 2018 is a digital map with 399 "permanent" districts, and 23 "temporary" ones, totaling 422.  The permanent ones are the same as the districts in the 399 AGCHO set of 2012, but with new codes and more accurate borders.  They cover the whole country and can be mapped without using the "temporary" districts.  The 23 "temporary" districts are newer ones split from their original "permanent" districts, but not yet ratified by the Majlis.   The "All 422" combines the two sets. See the "422 AGCHO/ARAZI 2018" tab for more background.   Sources: The AGCHO / ARAZI set: Afghan Admin. Map, Afg. Geodesy and Cartography Head Office, a unit of ARAZI, Kabul, 2018.

column11: (6) District name, Farsi:  Follows CSO, for the most part. [Not been validated.]

column12: (7) District name, Pashto.  CSO for the most part.  [Not validated.]
